alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Yuma and northeastern Kit Carson Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of Bonny Reservoir to 21 miles east of Cope. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bonny Reservoir. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 197 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado...and northwestern Kansas.
